answerText: Manfred[10] Manfred is a crazy lord in this novel, in which he tries to maintain control of the title estate after his son, Conrad, dies when a helmet falls on him.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 3 | 4 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character wants to divorce his wife, Hippolita, who has failed to bear him children, and plans to wed Isabella. [10] Name this man who goes to Jerome's church where he accidentally stabs his daughter, Matilda, thinking she is actually Isabella having an affair with Theodore.
